node.title: Donald Trump Has 'Two or Three' People in Mind to Lead GOP in 2024 if He Doesn't Run
node.description: The former president told Hugh Hewitt he would make the decision to run again after the 2022 midterms.

node.title: Union Urges Walmart, Kroger, Other Chains to Reinstate COVID Protective Measures
node.description: The union asked store chains to encourage mask use, provide hand sanitizer and masks to employees and re-establish social distancing measures.

node.title: Mississippi Public Universities Withdraw Vaccine Mandates After Biden Rule Blocked
node.description: "While this action stays the mandate, the benefits of getting vaccinated are clear," University of Mississippi Chancellor Glenn Boyce wrote.

node.title: Annie Farmer Tells Court Ghislaine Maxwell, Jeffrey Epstein Forced Themselves on Her
node.description: Annie Farmer testified Friday that Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein made unwanted sexual contact with her at a New Mexico ranch in 1996.

node.title: Taylor Swift Copyright Lawsuit May Go to Trial, Judge Rules
node.description: Taylor Swift is accused of stealing lyrics in her hit song “Shake It Off” from the song “Playas Gon’ Play” by the R&B trio 3LW.

node.title: What to Do This Weekend
node.description: Any big plans?

node.title: Omicron: A Big Deal About Small ‘O’
node.description: The Greek letter auditions for a different role in our lexicon.

node.title: Are Vaccine Polls Flawed?
node.description: Researchers say that two large surveys aren’t representative.

node.title: The Other, Seemingly Endless, State of Emergency in British Columbia
node.description: The province announced annual and monthly record numbers of opioid-related overdose deaths, further prompting calls for changes to laws.

node.title: Is Brisbane emerging as Australia's sporting capital?
node.description: Sydneysiders will scoff, and Melburnians will probably spit out their macchiatos, but you can make a valid argument that Brisbane is on the rise as the hub of Australian sport, writes Dan Colasimone.

node.title: Gold Coast COVID-19 cases a sign double-doughnut days are over, experts say
node.description: With Queensland about to throw open the borders to interstate visitors from COVID-19 hotspots, the state's health experts warn the latest outbreaks on the Gold Coast are a sign of things to come.

node.title: Dozens of migrants killed in Mexico truck crash
node.description: At least 53 people have been killed and dozens more have been injured after the truck they were being transported in crashed in southern Mexico, authorities say.

node.title: President Biden assails Kellogg’s plan to replace striking workers.
node.description: The president said he was “deeply troubled” by management’s plan, calling it an “existential attack” on union members. Their walkout began in October.

node.title: Thousands in Oregon Face Eviction as Rental Aid Dries Up, Lawmakers Scramble for Solutions
node.description: About $119 million in federal rent assistance in Oregon hasn't yet reached renters, but applications closed this month and thousands could face eviction.

node.title: Prince William and Kate Middleton release family Christmas card
node.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge release a new family photo of the royal couple and their three children, taken during a trip to Jordan earlier this year.

node.title: Alex Murdaugh Now Faces Nearly 50 Charges for Stealing $6.2M from Clients, Court Says
node.description: Murdaugh could face hundreds of years in prison if convicted of all the felony charges.

node.title: Georgia Republican Candidate for Gov David Perdue Joins Lawsuit Challenging 2020 Election
node.description: The former senator has been vocal about believing the 2020 election was stolen from former President Donald Trump.

node.title: Ex-County Worker Collin Michael Williams Guilty of Defacing Black Inmate's Memorial
node.description: The 21-year-old pleaded guilty to four charges and will be sentenced in January.

node.title: Branka spent the past month hearing about the 'missed opportunities' to save her parents. Here's what happened
node.description: Reliving the horror of the COVID-19 outbreak at Melbourne's St Basil's aged care home has been a painful experience for the families of those who died. Now they are hoping for some answers.

node.title: England needs 300 more runs to put pressure back on Australia, Dawid Malan says
node.description: England batter Dawid Malan says England needs 300 more runs to be in with a chance of pulling off a historic Ashes recovery at the Gabba.

node.title: Relax. Omicron Isn’t Going to Take Down the Economy.
node.description: The economy is better positioned to absorb the damage of each successive wave of the virus.

node.title: How’s the Economy? Biden Sees a Boom. Many Americans Don’t.
node.description: The president has struggled to sell strong growth and job gains to a public that appears more concerned about rising prices — and remains anxious about Covid.

node.title: 6 More Subpoenas Issued in House Panel’s Jan. 6 Investigation
node.description: Those issued subpoenas included two men who met with President Donald J. Trump in his private dining room on Jan. 4 and Mr. Trump’s former political affairs director.

node.title: 'Combative Passenger' Allegedly Assaulted Flight Attendant, Air Marshal on Delta Flight
node.description: Footage of the altercation was posted to social media and showed the passenger resisting arrest by an air marshal.

node.title: Florida Aquarium to Spread Winter the Dolphin's Ashes in Gulf of Mexico, Create Memorial
node.description: Winter was rescued along Florida's East Coast in December of 2005 when her tail was caught in a crab trap rope, causing it to be amputated.

node.title: Endang lived in a village at the foot of a volcano. She never considered moving – until now
node.description: Endang Pujiastuti is one of thousands of people who have been forced to flee their homes in Indonesia because of a deadly volcano eruption. She and other survivors recount how they escaped.

node.title: The anticipated rise in COVID cases in NSW is finally here — and La Niña is not helping
node.description: More than seven weeks after NSW's "Freedom Day", COVID-19 case numbers in the state are finally beginning to rise as an expert warns indoor celebrations are "high-risk settings".

node.title: Victoria's COVID hospitalisations are stable, but show few signs of dropping as we head into 2022
node.description: The number of COVID-19 patients has been sitting at about 300 for the past few weeks, but intensive care clinicians aren't expecting it to drop by much as the pandemic enters its third year.

node.title: What one comedy-of-errors date taught me about my disability and disclosure
node.description: When Caleb Rixon suffered a catastrophic stroke aged 24, his life and career as a musical performer was turned upside down. While the path back to dating has been full of potholes, he's learnt a few things along the way.

node.title: Daniel Andrews has started his Christmas holidays, but he’s leaving behind a divided Labor caucus
node.description: The internal gears of both Victorian Labor and the opposition are on show as preselection processes play out ahead of next year's state election. With anger and division rife, Richard Willingham asks if there is a risk of some MPs going rogue in 2022.
